intro: Cynanchum luteynii, commonly known as the yellow milkvetch, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asclepiadaceae. It is native to certain regions of Asia, particularly China, where it grows in arid and semi-arid environments. The plant is characterized by its slender stems, trifoliate leaves, and clusters of yellow flowers that bloom in summer. It produces a milky sap, which is a common feature among species in its family. Cynanchum luteynii is often found in rocky soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions.
